file_content.text: Stand by. I'm routing comm traffic through our Mid-Rim outposts; you're on a six-second delay until I resynchronize the datastream.
Three. Two. One. Synched and secured.
Tracking systems show you're in the Castle Lands of Alderaan. Enjoy the view, Cipher--I hear the mountains are lovely.
After the last few worlds, I'll be sure to appreciate it.
That's a welcome change.
It'll keep you sane.
No more beautiful than my Watcher.
[Flirt] Is that so?
But are they icier? Don't answer that.
Hard to tell from here--there's not much to see in the spaceport.
I'll let you know.
I imagine not. Something to look forward to, then.
I didn't come all this way to admire the scenery.
Enough playing tour guide.
No, you didn't. And we have more important things to discuss.
Alderaan is governed by the wealthiest noble families in the galaxy. They've feuded for centuries, and are presently engaged in a full scale war.
You're here because Imperial Intelligence believes that one of the noble houses--or a noble within one of the houses--is financing the Eagle's terror network.
What sort of financing are we talking about?
Give me the rundown.
Money for weapons, transportation, bribes... anything the cells need.
I thought the terrorists operated on the cheap?
Why do they need funding?
They do--in relative terms. But for cells that aren't self-supporting, costs add up quickly. Weapons, transportation, bribes, everything.
Maybe you should assign an accountant to this job.
What am I, an auditor?
This isn't about credit trails. These are dangerous people.
The Empire's resources are tied up supporting House Thul's efforts to claim the throne. But Intelligence does have one asset--Vector Hyllus.
Vector was an Imperial ambassador to the nobles, but he was later... repurposed. Now he's with the Killiks--Alderaan's native alien species.
You think this Vector knows something useful?
Does he have information?
He's an expert on the political situation. But I should explain.
I'm not familiar with them. What's their story?
Killiks?
The Killiks are an insectoid species that evolved on Alderaan. Most of the nests migrated into space millennia ago, but a few remained planetside.
Why are you being cagey, Watcher Two?
You're avoiding something.
Apologies. Vector's is an unusual case, and I should explain.
When Vector approached the Killiks on a mission of diplomacy, they absorbed him into their collective intelligence. He's part of their hive mind.
However, he continues to file activity reports, and we believe he's still loyal to the Empire--even if he's barely human anymore.
So what's our next step?
Understood.
He's part Killik?
Prolonged exposure to the Killiks induces physiological changes. He shares thoughts, feelings with them, but we don't know much more.
A lack of humanity shouldn't compromise anyone.
Loyalty isn't a matter of species.
There are always exceptions. But we musn't forget that they're rare.
You're asking me to trust someone who thinks like an alien.
He's been compromised.
If he's a security risk, you may eliminate him after the mission--but no sooner.
We've requisitioned Vector from the Diplomatic Service and given him a need-to-know overview. You'll rendezvous at these coordinates.
Use him to eliminate any noble or house funding the terrorists. Watcher Two out.
I'll let you know.
I'll let you know.
